intro: Searsia magalismontana, commonly known as the Natal glory bush, is a shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy yellow flowers that appear in spring. The plant has pinnate leaves and produces small, round, yellowish fruits that are edible for some animals. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for ornamental gardening in suitable climates. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
